alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 12:06PM PDT until March 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following county, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 330 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grizzly Creek Redwoods State Park, Garberville, Richardson Grove State Park, Myers Flat, Bridgeville, Weott, Alderpoint, Redway, Dinsmore, Pepperwood, Richardson Grove, Miranda, Blocksburg, Fort Seward, Shively, Benbow and Bull Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
